title: Zip Lining in Snowdonia
strapline: Conquer your fears and soak in the views on some of the UK's most thrilling zip lines.
metaDescription: Experience the thrill of zip lining in Snowdonia! From Velocity 2 to Bounce Below, plan your adventure today.
heroAlt: A zip liner soars across Penrhyn Quarry in Snowdonia against a backdrop of slate mountains and blue sky.
introduction:
Snowdonia is synonymous with adventure, and if you’re looking for an adrenaline rush with a view, **zip lining Snowdonia** is hard to beat. Forget generic theme park rides – here, you're soaring across former slate quarries, through ancient forests, and even underground in vast caverns. Zip World dominates the scene, and rightly so; they’ve transformed industrial heritage into world-class attractions. 

The big draw is Velocity 2 at Penrhyn Quarry – the fastest zip line in the world. It's a real bucket-list item. But don't overlook the other options. Titan, a series of shorter zips, offers a less terrifying but equally scenic experience, perfect if you're a bit nervous. Zip World Fforest in Betws-y-Coed is great for families, with multiple courses and plenty to keep everyone entertained. And for something truly unique, Bounce Below and the Caverns offer underground adventures unlike anything else you'll find. 

**Zip lining in Snowdonia** isn’t just about the adrenaline. It's about experiencing the landscape in a completely new way. It's about seeing the scars of industry and the reclaiming power of nature. Be warned though: prices can be steep, and booking in advance is essential, especially during peak season. But if you're after a memorable adventure in a stunning setting, it’s worth every penny. If you're not a fan of heights, maybe stick to the hiking trails, but for everyone else: strap in and enjoy the ride! 

One of the best parts about **zip lining in Snowdonia** is that, when you're finished, you're surrounded by all sorts of great restaurants, shops and other activities. It makes it an excellent hub for a holiday in the region.
bestSeason: March-October (some activities run year-round but check availability)

spots.name: Velocity 2 (Penrhyn Quarry)
spots.description: The world's fastest zip line, reaching speeds of over 100mph. You're strapped into a 'flying' position and launched across the stunning Penrhyn Quarry, with views of Anglesey on a clear day. It's an intense but exhilarating experience.
spots.notSuitableFor: Those with a severe fear of heights or certain medical conditions (check with Zip World)
spots.parking: Large car park at Penrhyn Quarry (LL57 4YG). Cost is around £5. Arrive early during peak season as it can fill up.
spots.insiderTip: Book the earliest slot possible for the best weather conditions and fewer crowds. The cafe can get very busy at lunchtime, so grab a pastry before you head out.

spots.name: Titan (Blaenau Ffestiniog)
spots.description: Europe's largest zip zone, featuring three zip lines that descend from the top of Llechwedd Slate Caverns. It's a longer experience than Velocity 2, with stunning views over the Moelwynion mountains. You're seated during the ride, making it a bit less intimidating.
spots.bestFor: Families and groups looking for a scenic adventure
spots.notSuitableFor: Those with limited mobility (there's some walking involved)
spots.parking: Large car park at Llechwedd Slate Caverns (LL41 3NB). Cost is included in the ticket price.
spots.insiderTip: Wear layers, as it can be chilly at the top of the quarry. Bring a small backpack to carry water and snacks – there are no facilities on the mountain.

spots.name: Zip World Fforest (Betws-y-Coed)
spots.description: A network of zip lines, nets, and rope bridges suspended in the trees. Fforest is geared towards families, with different courses to suit all abilities. It's a fun and active way to explore the woodland.
spots.bestFor: Families with children and groups of friends
spots.notSuitableFor: Very young children (minimum height restrictions apply)
spots.parking: Dedicated car park at Zip World Fforest (LL24 0HX). Cost is approximately £5.
spots.insiderTip: Wear comfortable, closed-toe shoes. Bring gloves if you have them, as the ropes can be tough on your hands. There are picnic tables if you want to bring your own lunch.

spots.name: Quarry Karts (Llechwedd)
spots.description: Not strictly zip-lining, but an exhilarating downhill karting experience on the slopes of the Llechwedd Slate Quarry. Steer your gravity-powered kart down a winding track with stunning views.
spots.bestFor: Those seeking a different kind of adrenaline rush
spots.parking: Large car park at Llechwedd Slate Caverns (LL41 3NB). Cost is included in the ticket price.
spots.insiderTip: Check the weather forecast and dress accordingly, as you'll be exposed to the elements. The karts can get quite muddy, so don't wear your best clothes.

spots.name: Bounce Below (Blaenau Ffestiniog)
spots.description: Imagine trampolines in a giant underground slate cavern. Bounce Below offers a unique and surreal experience, bouncing between different levels of the cavern on massive nets. It's surprisingly tiring!
spots.bestFor: Families and those looking for a fun and unusual activity
spots.notSuitableFor: Those with claustrophobia or mobility issues
spots.parking: Large car park at Llechwedd Slate Caverns (LL41 3NB). Cost is included in the ticket price.
spots.insiderTip: Wear comfortable clothing and closed-toe shoes. It can get warm in the cavern, so dress in layers. Book in advance, especially during peak season.

spots.name: Caverns (Blaenau Ffestiniog)
spots.description: An underground adventure course involving zip lines, rope bridges, and tunnels deep inside the Llechwedd slate caverns. It's a challenging and unique experience, testing your balance and coordination.
spots.notSuitableFor: Those with claustrophobia, fear of heights, or limited mobility
spots.parking: Large car park at Llechwedd Slate Caverns (LL41 3NB). Cost is included in the ticket price.
spots.insiderTip: Wear old clothes and sturdy shoes, as you'll be getting dirty. Bring gloves if you have them. Be prepared for some tight spaces and challenging obstacles.

spots.name: Skyride (Betws-y-Coed)
spots.description: Although permanently closed, it's worth knowing it existed. This was a high ropes course in Zip World Fforest offering a challenging and rewarding experience. This spot is now part of the existing Zip World Fforest.
spots.bestFor: Adventurous individuals and groups (Now part of the broader Zip World Fforest package)
spots.notSuitableFor: Those with a strong fear of heights (Now part of the broader Zip World Fforest package)
spots.parking: Dedicated car park at Zip World Fforest (LL24 0HX). Cost is approximately £5.
spots.estimatedCost: Now part of the Zip World Fforest costs
spots.insiderTip: Now part of the Zip World Fforest costs

practicalInfo.weather: Snowdonia's weather is notoriously unpredictable. Conditions can change rapidly, even on a sunny day. Be prepared for wind, rain, and cold temperatures, especially at higher elevations. Always check the forecast before you go and be prepared to adjust your plans if necessary.
gearChecklist: Waterproof jacket – essential, even if the forecast looks good
Warm layers – fleece, thermal base layer, hat and gloves
Sturdy footwear – closed-toe shoes are required for all Zip World activities
Comfortable clothing – avoid loose clothing that could get caught
Sunscreen – even on cloudy days, the sun can be strong at altitude
Water bottle – stay hydrated, especially during physically demanding activities
Gloves - for gripping ropes on Fforest Coaster and similar
Sunglasses – protect your eyes from the glare
Snacks – fuel for your adventure, especially if there are no cafes nearby

gettingThere.publicTransport: Bangor and Llandudno Junction are the nearest main train stations, with bus connections to Bethesda, Llanberis, and Betws-y-Coed. The Snowdon Sherpa bus service connects many of the popular attractions and villages.
gettingThere.parkingTips: Parking can be limited at peak times, especially at popular spots like Penrhyn Quarry and Betws-y-Coed. Arrive early or consider using the Snowdon Sherpa bus service. Pay attention to parking restrictions and avoid parking illegally.

practicalInfo.safety: Always follow the instructions of Zip World staff. Wear the provided safety equipment correctly. Be aware of your surroundings and potential hazards. Check weather conditions before you go. In case of emergency, dial 999 and ask for mountain rescue. Mobile phone signal can be patchy in some areas.

faqs.question: What's the fastest zip line in Snowdonia?
faqs.answer: Velocity 2 at Zip World Penrhyn Quarry is the fastest zip line in Snowdonia, and the world. It reaches speeds of over 100mph.

faqs.question: Is zip lining in Snowdonia suitable for beginners?
faqs.answer: Yes, Zip World Fforest in Betws-y-Coed offers courses suitable for beginners and families. Titan at Llechwedd is also a good option for those new to zip lining.

faqs.question: What should I wear for zip lining in Snowdonia?
faqs.answer: Wear comfortable clothing, including layers, as the weather can change quickly. Closed-toe shoes are essential. Avoid loose clothing that could get caught on the equipment.

faqs.question: How much does zip lining in Snowdonia cost?
faqs.answer: Prices vary depending on the activity. Velocity 2 costs between £99 and £135 per person, while other activities like Bounce Below start from around £30 per person.

faqs.question: Do I need to book in advance for zip lining?
faqs.answer: Yes, booking in advance is highly recommended, especially during peak season. Zip World activities are very popular and often sell out.

faqs.question: Are there age or weight restrictions for zip lining in Snowdonia?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are age, height and weight restrictions for most Zip World activities. Check the Zip World website for specific requirements for each activity.

faqs.question: What if the weather is bad when I'm supposed to go zip lining in Snowdonia?
faqs.answer: Zip World will usually close if the weather is dangerously bad. Contact them directly and see what options there are for rescheduling. Safety first.

postActivitySpots.name: Zip World Penrhyn Quarry Cafe
postActivitySpots.description: Convenient cafe at Penrhyn Quarry, serving hot and cold drinks, snacks, and light meals. Great views of the quarry.

postActivitySpots.name: Pete's Eats
postActivitySpots.description: A Llanberis institution, Pete's Eats is known for its massive portions and hearty meals. Popular with climbers and outdoor enthusiasts.

postActivitySpots.name: The Cottage Loaf
postActivitySpots.description: Traditional pub in Llanberis, serving a range of real ales and pub food. Cosy atmosphere and a good place to relax after a day outdoors.

postActivitySpots.name: Caffi Siabod
postActivitySpots.description: Popular cafe in Capel Curig, serving a range of hot and cold food, including breakfasts, sandwiches, and cakes. Good views of Tryfan and the surrounding mountains.

postActivitySpots.name: Blondies Coffee Shop
postActivitySpots.description: Friendly coffee shop in Bethesda, known for its delicious cakes, sandwiches, and coffee. Popular with locals and visitors alike.

accommodation.name: YHA Snowdon Llanberis
accommodation.description: Budget-friendly hostel in Llanberis, ideal for hikers and climbers. Close to the Snowdon Mountain Railway and Pete's Eats.

accommodation.name: Plas Curig Hostel
accommodation.description: Another great bunkhouse option in Capel Curig, close to Tryfan and the Ogwen Valley. Good for groups.

accommodation.name: Pen-y-Gwryd Hotel
accommodation.description: Historic hotel at the foot of Snowdon, famous as a training base for the 1953 Everest expedition. A classic climber's hotel.

accommodation.name: The Royal Victoria Hotel Snowdonia
accommodation.description: Traditional hotel located in Llanberis, close to many attractions and zip lining spots.

accommodation.name: Bryn Dinas Camping Pods
accommodation.description: Unique camping pods with incredible views of Snowdon and the surrounding countryside. Offers a modern glamping experience.
